subject: Pro x pedals return
description_text:
Dear simsonn support team

I hope you're well. I have recently purchased a set of your pro x pedals
from your website (Order #SSN3158) and, unfortunately am not satisfied with
the product. After testing I've found that they do not meet my expectations
and would like to arrange a return and refund in accordance with your
return policy.

Could you please let me know the steps I need to follow to return the
pedals. The item is in its original packaging in new condition

Thank you for your help,

Jack Artherton

conversations.body_text: Hi Jack Artherton,    I'm sorry to hear that. What's the problem with your pedal?

Hello and thank you for your response,

The issues are mainly to do with the noise coming from them as when I press
the throttle it has a very loud squeak. It also is very rough having an
almost jolty response, feeling as if it gets stuck at points in its travel.
I have also had issues when pressing the brake with noise from the
baseplate.

Some more issues are with the haptic reactors as they can be very
temperamental in use often disconnecting.

Overall they just haven't provided a smooth or reliable feel and I am
afraid these hardware issues lead me to wanting to return them. Could you
please advise me to the steps to take to process with the return &
subsequent refund

Thank you,

Jack Artherton

Hi Jack Artherton,    The throttle uses a single-direction hydraulic damper, and the sound of liquid movement inside is completely normal—it’s not caused by blockage or malfunction. When applying strong brake force, please make sure that the pedal base plate is securely fixed, otherwise the whole pedal assembly might produce noise due to insufficient support.  For connection or signal interruption issues, we recommend the following grounding solution:    Connect the PC case to the simulator frame;    Connect the main controller box to any metal screw on the pedal.    This can effectively improve stability. The main cause of such problems is usually that the wall outlet your PC is plugged into does not have a reliable three-prong ground, resulting in unstable grounding.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding     https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1n291hi/solution_for_simsonn_vam_pro_emi_issues/

Thank you for your detailed response.

I understand the points regarding the hydraulic damper, base plate support,
and grounding. However, after reviewing your suggestions and testing the
pedals again, the issues are still present. The throttle continues to feel
extremely jolty, as if getting stuck throughout its travel, and the overall
pedal feel remains unsatisfactory. The noises (loud squeaks from the
construction itself not damper) and inconsistencies are not what I would
expect from a properly functioning set.

At this point, I would like to proceed with a return/refund, as the pedals
do not meet my expectations despite the troubleshooting steps provided.

Please let me know the next steps in the return process.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

Best regards,
Jack Artherton

Hi Jack Artherton,  If the issue is related to noise during use, please record a short video and send it to us. Our engineers will check if there’s any installation issue and assist you in resolving it quickly. You can share the video with us via Google Drive — please make sure the access permissions are set correctly. We’ll review it promptly and help you resolve the issue.

Jack Artherton

Hi Jack Artherton,  You only need to apply lubricant to the noisy parts according to the manual to resolve the noise issue. The pedals require regular maintenance. Additionally, this situation does not qualify for a refund under our policy.              https://www.simsonn.com/pages/simsonn-product-manuals

I reported faults within days of delivery, provided the requested video,
and made clear I was not seeking a repair, only a refund (emails of 11
November and 15 November) [1]. The throttle is jolty/sticking throughout
its travel, there are loud squeaks from the construction, and the pedal
feel is inconsistent. The goods are not of satisfactory quality.

I am exercising my short‑term right to reject the goods for a full refund
under the UK Consumer Rights Act 2015. In the alternative, I am also
exercising my right to cancel under the Consumer Contracts Regulations 2013.

Please confirm within 7 calendar days:

1) You will issue a full refund to my original payment method upon return,
including any standard outbound delivery charge;
2) You will provide a prepaid tracked return label, or confirm in writing
you will reimburse my tracked return postage because the goods are faulty;
3) The RMA number and correct return address.

If I do not receive confirmation within 7 days, I will proceed with a
chargeback via the payment provider and pursue my statutory remedies.

Kind regards,
Jack Artherton
185 Elburton Road
